meanings.definition: A person or organism that thrives in acidic environments.
meanings.sent1: The acidophile bacteria in the soil love the acidic conditions.
meanings.sent2: The acidophile fish happily swims in the acidic lake.
meanings.sent3: The acidophile plants had a party in the vinegar.
meanings.sent4: She was an acidophile, finding joy in the sourness of life.
meanings.sent5: The acidophile fungi danced in the lemon juice, celebrating their acidic home.

meanings.definition: An adjective describing something that is able to tolerate or thrive in acidic conditions.
meanings.sent1: The acidophile bacteria are resistant to the acidic environment.
meanings.sent2: The acidophile soil is perfect for growing certain plants.
meanings.sent3: The acidophile car battery seemed to enjoy the lemonade spill.
meanings.sent4: Her acidophile personality shone brightest in challenging situations.
meanings.sent5: The acidophile metal gleamed in the vinegar, unaffected by its corrosive nature.
